{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3582782,"name":"Tio","username":"Tio","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/d2c977/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-07T18:18:57.360Z","cooked":"

Hi

We are currently using Java to program our FRC robot. The programming is mostly done by mentors. We want the student to do the programming. Our school, the students are taught python because of college linked classes. I would like to know how well the support is for python and if we need help , will there be help at events if we need.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-04-07T18:19:39.129Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":50,"reads":275,"readers_count":274,"score":305.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":498312,"topic_slug":"python-teams-how-is-the-support","display_username":"Tio","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28847,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/python-teams-how-is-the-support/498312/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3582789,"name":null,"username":"aph5","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/c6cbf5/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-07T18:26:24.223Z","cooked":"

We migrated to Python from Java this season and have been pleased with the results. I’m a programing mentor for the team, and the students have truly run with the Python code. We (myself and another programming mentor) sometimes have to just nudge them in the right direction, but they are very self-directing and pulled off some (in my opinion) very impressive things with our robot.

There is sample code available in Python (and we’ll be publishing ours shortly). There is a lot of Java code out there, but we found that it’s pretty easy to look at FRC Java sample code and convert that to Python.

I should also add that I’ve gotten amazing support by asking Python questions about it here too.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-04-07T18:26:58.416Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":268,"readers_count":267,"score":83.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":498312,"topic_slug":"python-teams-how-is-the-support","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49468,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/python-teams-how-is-the-support/498312/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3582811,"name":"","username":"LHACK4142","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lhack4142/{size}/196107_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-07T18:43:05.204Z","cooked":"

I agree with @aph5.
All the examples are easily translatable into Python (as are other teams’ code). The APIs are basically the same, to the point that I was able to help another team using Java at Las Vegas despite never having programmed FRC in Java. In the same way, if someone knew Python but their team used Java, they’d probably be able to help a Python team at an event.
There is definitely sufficient support for Python-specific questions as well-- @virtuald alone is quick to respond to many questions.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-04-07T18:43:05.204Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":243,"readers_count":242,"score":48.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":498312,"topic_slug":"python-teams-how-is-the-support","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58301,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"coder in the corner"},"post_url":"/t/python-teams-how-is-the-support/498312/3","custom_user_title":"coder in the corner","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3582818,"name":"","username":"Akshaj_K","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/71c47a/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-07T18:45:17.177Z","cooked":"

We moved to Python this year, and fortunately, we were doing pretty good. The suppot is hard, but the robotpy dev is really helpful on Chief Delphi. I had a few issues at the beginning with limelight due to lack of code examples, but in the end we got it working. Depending on the framework you use, path planner and choreo could cause issues too. If you guys would like any help at anything, you can let me or my team (4611) know and we would be willing to help you.

Excellent support, timely updates, good examples (though we have developed our our conventions and framework structures as examples for other teams) and apppropriate performance with the right constraints in place (disable NI web server, minimize unncessary libraries, etc.).

2881 switched from Java to Python for the comp season and we’re taking it to champs in 2 weeks.

github.com

GitHub - frc2881/2025-Robot: Source code for the 2025 season (Reefscape)...

Source code for the 2025 season (Reefscape) competition robot

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-04-07T19:58:12.182Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":177,"readers_count":176,"score":35.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":498312,"topic_slug":"python-teams-how-is-the-support","display_username":"Robert Tuttle","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/frc2881/2025-Robot","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - frc2881/2025-Robot: Source code for the 2025 season (Reefscape) competition robot","clicks":14}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60779,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/python-teams-how-is-the-support/498312/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3582920,"name":"s-neff","username":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-07T20:06:21.401Z","cooked":"

Your problem is almost certainly not the actual language. Any motivated high schooler should be able to jump between Python and Java just fine, set that expectation out of the gate and they’ll measure up to it.

The school claiming to teach Python and the school actually teaching how to program a real project in a collaborative way using libraries to achieve objectives using Python are completely different things. Don’t expect moving languages to solve the underlying lack of knowledge of collaborative programming processes or ability to grok high level objectives of “these motors are wrapped in this subsystem which is called by this command”.

I recommend building a ‘skeleton robot’ that mostly works or is missing a non-critical subsystem for them to hack around inside of and complete final objectives and tuning within, before trying to get them to program a whole robot. It may take a few years to get to a whole robot. You’re in this for the long haul - when they start explaining the abstraction choices to each other, you’ll know you’re headed in the right direction.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-04-07T20:06:21.401Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":161,"readers_count":160,"score":62.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":498312,"topic_slug":"python-teams-how-is-the-support","display_username":"s-neff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28019,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/python-teams-how-is-the-support/498312/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3583020,"name":"Justin Buist","username":"Justin_Buist","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c77e96/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-07T21:38:06.931Z","cooked":"

Support for RobotPy itself is great. Python support across FRC is spotty.

We only used CTRE stuff on the robot this year, and their Python support is fantastic, but even there I found some cases where mypy’s type checker would toss errors despite the code being correct. Works, but, not a perfect implementation.

Other vendordeps like Grapple, when I tried to use their laser range finder, seemed nonfunctional.

And in our case using the MagicBot framework means giving up some integrations with things like PathPlanner or CTRE’s Swerve generator that are command based. But, I consider Magicbot a net positive. We built our drivetrain code around the tuner constants files that CTRE generated for our bot. PathPlanner was still useful for generating trajectories, we just followed them with our framework. Same for Choreo trajectories. They were both easy to work with.

The robotpy team rocks my socks.

Event support may be a bit more sporattic, simply because if lower adoption.

Vendor support is mostly as good as java.

Justin_Buist:

We only used CTRE stuff on the robot this year, and their Python support is fantastic, but even there I found some cases where mypy’s type checker would toss errors despite the code being correct.

I’m curious what issues you hit here. My team’s running mypy in CI without any issues.

Sorry, Pylance error, not mypy:

Argument of type “TalonFXConfiguration” cannot be assigned to parameter “configs” of type “SupportsSerialization” in function “apply”
“TalonFXConfiguration” is incompatible with protocol “SupportsSerialization”
“deserialize” is an incompatible type
Type “(to_deserialize: str) → StatusCode” is not assignable to type “(string: str) → StatusCode”
Parameter name mismatch: “string” versus "to_deserialize"PylancereportArgumentType

(variable) config: TalonFXConfiguration

Akshaj_K:

Depending on the framework you use, path planner and choreo could cause issues too.

I remember when PhotonVision’s build from C++ to Python breaks up (in 2023 or 2024, If I remember correctly) and I started paying more attention to some 3rd party features, and how my team could bypass some of these obstacles.

The problem is to know how to adapt it: for example, photonlibpy doesn’t have some modules/classes, and it can’t be adapted directly from Java examples, due some specific lack of them. PixyCam 2 is another example that also only has “official” support for FRC using Java (and LabVIEW). In this last case, we use the wpilib.SerialPort instead of any custom Pixy2 classes.

It would be nice if YAGSL or the majority of third-party community libraries could be use on code independently of the team’s language.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-04-09T13:02:29.284Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":65,"readers_count":64,"score":23.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":498312,"topic_slug":"python-teams-how-is-the-support","display_username":"Guilherme Samuel","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":3,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":47943,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/python-teams-how-is-the-support/498312/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3583655,"name":"","username":"Akshaj_K","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/71c47a/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-08T13:44:50.442Z","cooked":"

We decided to use limelight’s API instead of photovision. Since the limelight puts its readings onto network tables, it simplified it for our team. We had a few issues though like getting Megatag2. We had to rewrite the limelighthelpers Java file into Python to get it working.
